displaytitle: Sunset near St. Peter's, Rome (or Sunset on the Tiber)
creditline: Gift of Hugh Trumbull Adams, Class of 1935

titles.title: Sunset near St. Peter's, Rome (or Sunset on the Tiber)

makers.displaydate: 1825–1894; born Newburgh, NY; died Bridge of Allan, Scotland
makers.displaymaker: George Inness, 1825–1894; born Newburgh, NY; died Bridge of Allan, Scotland

texts.textentryhtml: Inness painted several distant views of St. Peter’s Basilica, beginning with a watercolor study executed on site in 1851-52. The undated Sunset near St. Peter's, Rome (or Sunset on the Tiber) relates closely to a later, 1871 portrayal of the commanding structure seen during daytime from a similar vantage point across the Tiber River, suggesting an approximate date for this evening scene, which would have been completed in the artist’s studio.

bibliography.boilertext: LeRoy Ireland, The works of George Inness: an illustrated catalgue raisonné, (Austin, TX: University of Texas Press, 1965).
bibliography.citation: LeRoy Ireland, The works of George Inness: an illustrated catalgue raisonné, (Austin, TX: University of Texas Press, 1965)., no. 531

bibliography.citation: Barbara T. Ross, "Nineteenth-century American landscape paintings: nine recent acquisitions", Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 44, no. 1 (1985): p. 4-13., p. 5, fig. 2
